intro: Matelea inops, commonly known as the ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Matelea inops is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, with deep roots and a long dormancy period during dry seasons.
